use so much of the street or sidewalk as shall be necessary for that purpose,
not to exceed one-half (1/2) of the street and one-half (1/2) of the sidewalk;
and provided further, that the street commissioner or chief of police, after
notice given to the owner, or person so obstructing such street, alley, or
public ground, as aforesaid, may remove any such fence, building, or
obstruction, or cause the same to be done and the necessary cost of such
removal may be recovered from such owner or other person so obstructing such
street, alley, or public ground by the city, before any proper court having
jurisdiction. It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to rake,
place or mow fallen tree leaves, grass clippings or other yard waste into the
pavement or into the gutter of any public street unless directed by the city of
Aledo. No person shall permit grass clippings from mower swaths to remain upon
city sidewalks, street pavements, gutters of any public street, or on abutting
property not owned or occupied by said person. The penalty for violating this
section shall be as set forth in section
6-11-4 of this code. (Ord. 10/2011, 7-5-2011)
8-11-2: MONUMENTS, MARKERS:
It shall be unlawful for any person whatever or whoever, within the corporate
limits of the city to move, disturb, remove, deface, molest or destroy any
stake, grade, grade stake, monument or marker, set or placed within the city
limits for the purpose of establishing either temporarily or permanently any
street, sidewalk, or improvement grade or level, or other grade or level in the
city, when the same or either of the same may hereafter be placed or designated
by or under the authority or direction of the municipal authorities of the
city, or where the same or either of the same, may now be legally located or
identified or designated by competent legal authority; and it shall further be
unlawful for any person in the city to erase or otherwise obliterate or deface
any chalk or pencil mark, or other mark made for the purpose of indicating the
location of any such grade or level within the city; provided, however that the
city engineer or other proper officer acting under the authority or instruction
of the municipal authorities shall have the right to move or remove any such
monument or marker, providing the same shall be accurately replaced, and its
location correctly noted by any such proper person moving or removing any such
monument or marker. (Ord. 2/12, 6-3-1912)
8-11-3: BARRICADES:
It shall be unlawful for any person to molest, injure, damage, destroy or
remove any barricade, guard planking, or other protection erected or placed
upon any street or alley in said city to protect any unfinished portion of any
public improvement or work from injury or destruction, or to make any use
whatever of any such barricade, guard planking or other protection, calculated
to injure or destroy the same, or to in anywise injure or damage any unfinished
portion of any such public improvement or work erected or placed within the
city. (Ord. 10/12, 11-4-1912)
8-11-4: MACHINERY; EQUIPMENT ON PUBLIC WAYS:
It shall hereafter be unlawful for any person to obstruct in any way any
street, boulevard or sidewalk along the paved or surfaced part of any street in
the city. Any person placing or allowing to remain upon such boulevards and
sidewalks of any street in the city any vehicle, machinery, articles or matter
of any kind whatsoever shall be deemed to be obstructing the same, within the
meaning of this section, and placing or allowing to remain upon said sidewalks
or boulevards of any vehicle, machinery, articles or matter of any kind shall
be and is hereby deemed a nuisance. (Ord. 8/49, 4-17-1950)
The provisions hereof shall not apply to those boulevards prepared for and
maintained by the city nor to those portions of the street which have been
designated for the express purpose of the temporary parking of motor vehicles
whether the same be now provided for or hereafter established. The term
"temporary parking" is hereby defined to be the parking of a motor vehicle in
the areas referred to for a period not to exceed forty eight (48) consecutive
hours. (Ord. 10/12, 11-4-1912; amd. Ord. 12/64, 5-3-1965)
8-11-5: SIGNS; BILLBOARDS:
It shall be unlawful for any person other than a city official or employee
conducting city business to place, erect or fasten any billboard or other
placard, sign, notice, or other type of posting (collectively referred to
within this section as "signs") upon public property or property owned by the
city of Aledo, within the public right of way, upon any part of any sidewalk
within the corporate limits of the city; or upon any part of any public street
or alley in the city. It shall further be unlawful to nail, paste or otherwise
fasten to or hang upon any telephone, electric light or telegraph pole within
the corporate limits of the city, any signs of any character or description
whatsoever; or to attach the same to any tree, light post or other object in
any street or alley in the city. This section shall not apply to signs or
advertisements extending out from and supported by buildings abutting upon any
street or sidewalk in the city, which are so placed, hung or erected as to
comply with the present regulations of the city relative to the same; nor apply
to any billposting boards now or hereafter erected with the permission of the
city. Signs erected in violation of this section shall be subject to immediate
abatement upon identification. (Ord. 06/2016, 6-6-2016)
8-11-6: STREET SALES:
It shall be unlawful for any person to expose to sale, offer to sell, or to
vend or sell any article or articles or any goods, wares or merchandise of any
kind or nature whatever, or to permit any of his agents or employees to expose
to sale, offer to sell or to vend or sell any article or articles or any goods,
wares or merchandise of any kind or nature whatever, from any rack, wagon,
stand, motor truck, pushcart, or other vehicle, whether stationary or movable,
upon the streets, sidewalks and public places within the limits of the city.
However, this section shall not be construed to apply to house to house selling
by a farmer, fruit and vine grower, and gardener, engaged in selling the
produce of his farm, orchard, vineyard or garden, nor shall this section be
construed to prevent the display by any merchant of goods, wares or merchandise
on the sidewalk in front of his regularly established place of business so long
as the same shall be done in conformity with any existing ordinance on that
subject. (Ord. 4/32, 3-20-1933)
CHAPTER 12
EXCAVATIONS 1
SECTION:
8-12-1:   Definitions
8-12-2:   Permit Required
8-12-3:   Application
8-12-4:   Conditions For Granting Permit
8-12-5:   Sale Of Excavated Material
8-12-6:   Prior Notice
8-12-7:   Exceptions
8-12-8:   Performance
8-12-9:   Excavation Clearance
8-12-10:   Plastic Installation
8-12-11:   Backfilling
8-12-12:   Demolition Clearance (Rep. by Ord. 16/2017, 6-5-2017)
8-12-13:   Hazardous And Emergency Procedures
8-12-14:   Standards And Procedures
8-12-15:   Penalties
 
Notes
1 1. See also chapter 16 of this title.
8-12-1: DEFINITIONS:
   BLASTING: The use of an explosive to excavate.
   CONTRACTOR: Any person, including a subcontractor, who contracts with a
utility operator or property owner, public or private, for the purpose of
engaging in at least, excavation of any structure below the existing grade.
   DIRECTOR: The Director of Public Works and Utilities of the City of Aledo.
   EMERGENCY: Any condition which may cause an interruption of essential
services resulting from the destruction of, disruption of, or damage to
underground utility lines. ("Emergency" is classified as less severe than
"hazardous".)
   EXCAVATE: The movement or removal of earth, using mechanized equipment or
blasting, and includes augering, backfilling, digging, ditching, drilling,
grading, plowing-in, pulling-in, ripping, scraping, trenching and tunneling.
   HAZARDOUS: Any condition which may cause an interruption of essential
services and, in addition, may result in death or injury to persons or property
due to destruction of, disruption of, or damage to underground utility lines.
("Hazardous" is classified as more severe than "emergency".)
   MECHANIZED EQUIPMENT: Powered equipment used to excavate, and includes
equipment used for plowing in or pulling in cable or pipe.
   PERSON: Any individual, partnership, association, corporation, state,
subdivision or instrumentality of a state, or the legal representative thereof.
   PROPERTY OWNER: Any person who owns fee title to or leases a given area of
land, excluding, however, any recorded easement or right-of-way.
   SUPERINTENDENT: The General Superintendent of Public Works and Buildings of
the City.
   UTILITY LINE: Any underground conduit and its related facilities including
pipe or cable, by which a utility furnishes or transports material or services.
   UTILITY OPERATOR: Any person who furnishes or transports any of the
following materials or services by means of a utility line, including the City
of Aledo:
      (A)   Flammable, natural, toxic or corrosive gas.
      (B)   Petroleum, petroleum products and hazardous liquids.
      (C)   Electricity.
      (D)   Sanitary sewer.
      (E)   Storm drains.
      (F)   Communications.
      (G)   Water.
   WORKING DAYS: Monday through Friday, excluding, however, any public and
legal holidays. (Ord. 13/75, 11-17-1975; amd. Ord. 16/2017, 6-5-2017)
8-12-2: PERMIT REQUIRED:
No person, other than a duly authorized City employee in the course of his
employment, may undertake excavation within the corporate limits of the City
unless such person shall first obtain a permit therefor from the City as
hereinafter provided. (Ord. 16/2017, 6-5-2017)
8-12-3: APPLICATION:
Any person who proposes to do any work as prohibited in section
8-12-2 of this chapter, shall first file with the Clerk a petition in writing
which shall describe the location and extent of such proposed work, the object
thereof, and the approximate time necessary to complete the same and deposit
with the Clerk the sum pursuant to title 13, "Schedule Of Fees", of this Code.
(Ord. 16/2017, 6-5-2017)
8-12-4: CONDITIONS FOR GRANTING PERMIT:
The City Clerk shall, on receiving petition indicated in section
8-12-3 of this chapter, transmit same to Director for verification of site and
feasibility. The Director, after such verification shall, in writing, approve
said petition and return same to City Clerk who will cause petitioner to be
notified that petition is granted subject to the following conditions:
   (A)   An improved street or sidewalk shall be replaced or reconstructed and
any excavation filled under the direction of the Superintendent so that the
same shall be in as good and serviceable condition as it was prior to being
disturbed. (Ord. 13/75, 11-17-1975)
   (B)   All repairs in traveled portion of any street and at least three feet
(3') beyond the curb or ditch line shall contain suitable material to within
six inches (6") of the surface and the balance shall consist of the same
material as removed. All materials used in repairing any street or side portion
thereof as provided and required above shall be properly compacted and all
reconstruction and repair work on any street or side portion thereof shall be
done in a workmanlike manner subject to the direction and approval of the
Director of Public Works and Utilities. (Ord. 13/75, 11-17-1975; amd. Ord. 30/
82, 2-7-1983)
   (C)   All such replacement, reconstruction and filling shall be done under
the direction of and subject to the approval of the Director, and the materials
used therein shall be such as said Director shall designate. (Ord. 13/75, 11-
17-1975)
   (D)   Petitioner shall guarantee the entire expense of the replacement,
reconstruction or filling of any work permitted hereunder by depositing with
the Clerk, in cash or its equivalent, any sum required by the Director at the
time such permit is granted, but not less than the sum pursuant to title 13,
"Schedule Of Fees", of this Code, and if said Director fails to designate any
amount at the time such permit is acted upon, the deposit made with the Clerk
at the time such petition is filed shall be deemed sufficient. (Ord. 16/2017,
6-5-2017)
   (E)   Upon the completion of the work and the written approval thereof by
the Director, the Clerk shall deduct from the deposited guarantee, the costs
and expenses of the City of such replacement, reconstruction or filling not
otherwise paid by petitioner including an amount for the time spent by the City
employees in inspecting, supervising or working on such proposed work at the
hourly rate then paid such City employees by the City and repay the balance, if
any, to the petitioner. All amounts so deducted for costs and expenses shall be
paid into the General Corporate Fund of the City. (Ord. 13/75, 11-17-1975)
8-12-5: SALE OF EXCAVATED MATERIAL:
No person excavating earth or stone on any public street or ground belonging to
the City or other public place shall, without the permit of the Director, sell
or in any way dispose of the same, and any person violating this provision
shall pay to the City three (3) times the value of such property, to be
recovered by action in debt in favor of the City or withheld from the guarantee
deposited hereunder. (Ord. 13/75, 11-17-1975)
8-12-6: PRIOR NOTICE:
   (A)   Contractors shall notify all utility operators who maintain
underground utility lines in the area of the proposed excavation or blasting,
at least two (2) working days, but not more than ten (10) working days prior to
commencement of said excavation. This notification shall consist, at least, of
the following: (Ord. 16/2017, 6-5-2017)
      1.   The contractor's name and telephone number.
      2.   The name of the person for whom the proposed work is being done.
      3.   The date and approximate time work is to commence.
      4.   The location and approximate depth of proposed work.
      5.   The nature of work to be done.
      6.   Any special remarks. (Ord. 13/75, 11-17-1975)
   (B)   It shall be unlawful for any contractor to commence excavation on any
property without first receiving clearance for excavation from each utility
operator as provided in section
8-12-9 of this chapter. (Ord. 13/75, 11-17-1975; amd. Ord. 16/2017, 6-5-2017)
8-12-7: EXCEPTIONS:
   (A)   The requirements of section
8-12-2 of this chapter shall not apply to any property owner who, without the
aid of a contractor, is performing the work within the boundaries of his
property which does not require the acquisition of any permit issued by the
City of Aledo.
   (B)   The requirements of section
8-12-2 of this chapter shall not apply to a person acting as or for a City
franchised utility operator; provided, however, that this exception shall not
excuse the utility operator making the excavation from any liability for damage
caused by his negligence.
   (C)   The requirements of section
8-12-2 of this chapter shall not apply to any person acting as or for the
utility operator of a damaged line in making repairs to its own underground
facilities or repairs to the streets or alleys themselves in a condition of
emergency when such repairs must be made within a shorter period of time than
that provided for in the ordinance codified herein, provided, however, that
this exemption from obtaining information shall not excuse the person making
the excavation from any liability for damages caused by his negligence. (Ord.
13/75, 11-17-1975)
8-12-8: PERFORMANCE:
   (A)   Verification that site plans indicate finished grade, must be provided
to the utility operator in writing by contractor and property owner before
contractor may commence excavation for the installation of utility lines.
   (B)   When excavation approaches the estimated location of any existing
utility line(s), which shall have been previously located horizontally as
provided in section
8-12-9 of this chapter, the exact location of such existing utility line(s)
must be determined by adequately exposing same by hand digging within the
proposed limits of excavation before excavation may resume. To prevent damage
to such exposed existing utility line(s) or the protective coating thereof,
proper supports shall be provided where required. (Ord. 13/75, 11-17-1975)
   (C)   The act of obtaining information as required by this chapter shall not
excuse any person making any excavation from doing so in a careful and prudent
manner nor shall it excuse such person from liability for any damage resulting
from his negligence. (Ord. 16/2017, 6-5-2017)
8-12-9: EXCAVATION CLEARANCE:
   (A)   A utility operator who receives notification of a proposed excavation
pursuant to section
8-12-6 of this chapter and who has received, if applicable, verification of
site grading pursuant to section
8-12-8 of this chapter, shall provide clearance for excavation to the
contractor before such excavation may commence by:
      1.   At least one hour prior to the commencement of the proposed
excavation, horizontally locating its utility lines at the site, and notifying
the contractor that this marking has been accomplished; or
      2.   Notifying the contractor that the proposed excavation will not
affect its existing utility lines.
   (B)   In order to expedite horizontal location of utility lines, each
utility operator shall:
      1.   Provide locating services to mark all facilities affected by the
excavation.
      2.   Provide to designing engineers, horizontal location data on its
utility lines prior to field survey for designing new work so that such
information on existing utility lines may be included in survey notes.
      3.   Have the option to allow the locating crew of another utility
operator to horizontally locate said facilities, provided clearance to do so
has been given in writing. (Ord. 13/75, 11-17-1975)
8-12-10: PLASTIC INSTALLATION:
When in the installation of a utility line the line is of a nonferrous
material, an effective device shall also be installed such that locating
equipment can readily indicate horizontal location. (Method must be authorized
by utility operator.) (Ord. 13/75, 11-17-1975)
8-12-11: BACKFILLING:
When installation or repairs to utility lines has been completed an inspection
must be made by all utility operators concerned and authorization to proceed
with backfilling must precede any coverage of such lines. (Ord. 13/75, 11-17-
1975)
8-12-12: DEMOLITION CLEARANCE:
(Rep. by Ord. 16/2017, 6-5-2017)
8-12-13: HAZARDOUS AND EMERGENCY PROCEDURES:
   (A)   The Contractor:
      1.   When any person damages a utility line, or the protective coating
thereof, or accidently exposes or severs a utility line during excavation, an
emergency condition shall be deemed to exist and the utility operator of such
line shall be directly notified at that time. (Ord. 16/2017, 6-5-2017)
      2.   When any gas or flammable liquid utility line is severed, or damaged
to the extent that there is escapement of its contents, a hazardous condition
shall be deemed to exist and the utility operator of such line shall be
immediately notified.
      3.   Contractors shall display in plain sight on the instrument, or
control panel, or dash of all trucks and mechanized equipment operated by them,
the current telephone number(s) which is to be utilized to serve hazardous
condition notice as required in subsection (A)2 of this section.
      4.   The telephone numbers to be utilized in serving emergency condition
notice as required above shall be located at least on the site.
      5.   It shall be unlawful to backfill around a damaged utility line, as
described in subsections (A)1 and (A)2 of this section until the utility
operator of said line has been notified of such incident and has repaired the
damage and/or has given clearance to backfill in writing.
      6.   During emergency or hazardous conditions, it shall be lawful to
excavate, without using blasting, if notification as required in subsections
(A)1 and (A)2 of this section is given as soon as reasonably possible.
   (B)   The Utility Operator:
      1.   All utility operators shall make available on a twenty four (24)
hour basis, adequate emergency response crew(s) capable of performing all work
tasks necessary to cope with emergency or hazardous situation.
      2.   The decision to shut off a utility line during a hazardous condition
shall be vested in an appropriate representative of the utility company
concerned.
      3.   When adequate utility operator emergency response crews are not
available during a hazardous condition, the utility operator involved shall
employ other personnel to take the necessary action to shut off specific
utility valves or breakers serving the area.
         (a)   In order to facilitate this, the utility operator shall have
knowledge of and access to emergency shut off valves and breakers. In addition,
effective ninety (90) days after the adoption of this chapter, the appropriate
staff of that utility shall be trained in the use of implements employed to
shut off a utility line during a hazardous condition. Information and training
is to be provided by and through the cooperation of utility operator
representatives.
         (b)   Only the appropriate utility line representatives shall be
permitted to reopen any valve or breaker which was closed during such a
hazardous condition and only after a thorough check has indicated that it is
safe to place the affected lines back in service.
         (c)   The provisions of this subsection shall not be mandatory upon
the operators of flammable, natural, toxic or corrosive gas transmission
pipelines during a hazardous condition. (Ord. 13/75, 11-17-1975)
8-12-14: STANDARDS AND PROCEDURES:
   (A)   The horizontal location of all existing underground utility lines and
those underground utility lines proposed by any utility supplier shall be
indicated on all site plans, subdivision plans, or engineering plans prior to
City approval.
   (B)   Depending upon the size and importance of the utility line to be
affected, the affected utility supplier shall determine whether or not an
inspection by its representatives at the site of excavation is necessary during
the crossing of its utility lines.
   (C)   Preconstruction meetings between contractors and utility operators
should be scheduled prior to all excavation projects. (Ord. 13/75, 11-17-1975)
8-12-15: PENALTIES:
Any person who shall violate, disobey, omit, neglect or refuse to comply with
or who resists enforcement of any of the provisions of this title shall be
subject to a fine pursuant to title 12, "Schedule Of Fines", of this Code.
(Ord. 24/2016, 1-3-2017)
CHAPTER 13
NATURAL GAS SYSTEM
SECTION:
8-13-1:   Application For Taps And Service Connections
8-13-2:   Cost Of Taps And Connections
8-13-3:   Specifications For Regular Gas Service Connections
8-13-4:   Meters
8-13-5:   Inspections
8-13-6:   Meter Reading Conclusive
8-13-7:   Test Of Meters
8-13-8:   Separate Meters For Each Distinct Premises
8-13-9:   Damage To Equipment
8-13-10:   Parties Liable For Payment For Gas Service; Delinquent Gas Bills To
Be Liens Upon The Real Estate
8-13-11:   Gas Rate Schedule
8-13-12:   Service Discontinued; Renewal
8-13-13:   Interruption In Service Or Supply; City Not Liable
8-13-14:   Connection With Private Lines
8-13-15:   Regulations; Customers
8-13-16:   Rules; Contract
8-13-17:   Extensions
8-13-18:   Tampering With System
8-13-19:   Gas Committee
8-13-20:   Budget Billing Of Natural Gas
8-13-21:   Payment Of Charges
8-13-22:   Delinquent Bills; Payment In Installments
8-13-23:   Delinquent Customers; New Connections
8-13-1: APPLICATION FOR TAPS AND SERVICE CONNECTIONS:
   (A)   Applicant Requirements: Prior to connecting to the City of Aledo
natural gas distribution system the applicant shall complete an application for
gas connection, notice to applicants for natural gas service in the City of
Aledo, easement and excess flow valve request form. Only after completing each
of these documents shall the applicant be considered for City of Aledo natural
gas service.
   (B)   Definition Of Space Heating Customer: For the purpose of permitting
the personnel of the Gas Department to classify the various types of gas
services, only the following type of service shall be considered a space
heating service: any single piece of gas fired equipment having a maximum input
rating of more than seventy five thousand (75,000) BTU per hour. (Ord. 7/01, 7-
16-2001)
8-13-2: COST OF TAPS AND CONNECTIONS:
For all regular three-fourths inch (3/4") taps and service connections the City
will furnish and install a valve, service tee, service pipe, connection
fittings, regulator, meter and necessary stopcocks for all complete connections
made within the City limits and upon payment of the initial application fee
pursuant to title 13, "Schedule Of Fees", of this Code. The maximum length of
service line to be installed at this cost shall be one hundred feet (100') from
the property line and such additional lengths required are to be paid for by
the customer at a rate pursuant to title 13, "Schedule Of Fees", of this Code.
For all taps in excess of three-fourths inch (3/4") material, the City shall
charge the cost assessed to the City which exceeds that regular three-fourths
inch (3/4") material, meter and installation cost in addition to the initial
application fee. An additional fee shall be paid pursuant to title 13,
"Schedule Of Fees", of this Code for each residential three-fourths inch (3/4")
meter in excess of the first meter installed to the same premises. All hardware
furnished and installed by the City, including, without limitation, the valve,
service tee, service pipe, connection fittings, regulator, meter and necessary
stopcocks, shall remain the property of the City.
Where service lines can be installed in a location which will permit the
servicing of two (2) customers, the maximum length to be installed from the
property line shall be one hundred fifty feet (150').
Notwithstanding the provisions of the foregoing paragraphs pertaining to the
payment by the applicant as to the cost and installation of taps and
connections required to connect to the City natural gas system, any premises
connecting to the City natural gas system which is owned by a governmental unit
shall be subject to the following provision regarding payment and allocation
between the City and the respective governmental unit of the cost and
installation of any taps and service connections required to connect the
premises in question to the natural gas system operated by the City. In such
case, payment and allocation of the cost of taps and connections between the
City and the governmental unit in question incurred in order to connect the
premises to the natural gas system owned by the City shall be made as the
parties may agree before the connection is made.
For business or industrial purposes or for special space heating requirements
requiring larger than three-fourths inch (3/4") service pipe with incidental
larger fittings, stopcocks, regulators and meters, these service connections
shall be made in a like manner and the service line in excess of seventy five
feet (75') from the property line shall be paid for at actual cost to the City,
provided that upon application therefor, special permission may be granted by
the Council authorizing the applicant to make such service connections at their
own expense under the supervision of and subject to such reasonable conditions
and regulations as may be prescribed by such permit, none of these conditions
are to be inconsistent with the provisions of this chapter.
Failure to continue minimum monthly payments for the time specified shall
automatically forfeit the applicant's right for a free service connection.
Any applicant for service for space heating purposes must have his space
heating equipment installed and ready for service by or before September 1,
1958, in order to hold his application. A firm contract for installation of
such space heating equipment shall be considered adequate evidence of good
faith and shall be accepted in lieu of the actual equipment installation date
as specified herein. (Ord. 16/2017, 6-5-2017)
8-13-3: SPECIFICATIONS FOR REGULAR GAS SERVICE CONNECTIONS:
All gas service connections made to the gas mains of the distribution system of
the City shall be substantially as follows:
   (A)   The connection at the main shall consist of a valved service tee for
three-fourths inch (3/4") ID field pipe. Valve tees shall be welded in a
workmanlike manner to the main. The connection with the service tee shall be
made with a black iron street ell, nipple and insulated union. Service lines
shall consist of three-fourths inch (3/4") black iron pipe, coated and wrapped
to protect it against corrosion, which shall be laid approximately eighteen
inches (18") below the ground surface. Service lines shall be extended above
the ground surface approximately one foot (1') at or near the building to be
serviced and fitted with a three-fourths inch (3/4") black iron stopcock. Prior
to drilling the main for gas service, the aforementioned service line shall be
tested at one hundred (100) pounds' pressure. The regulator and meters shall be
capable of handling a sufficient volume of gas to serve the needs of the
customer. All materials and construction procedure shall conform to the latest
standards of the American Gas Association.
   (B)   Wherever it is necessary for service lines to cross under high type
pavements, the service line shall be installed by boring or jacking the service
line through underneath the pavement from a point six feet (6') outside of the
pavement to six feet (6') beyond the edge of the pavement. Copper pipe Type "K"
shall be used for this installation and shall be joined to standard black iron
service lines by means of dresser couplings and insulating adapter gaskets. The
insulating adapter gaskets shall be "Mueller" Catalog No. H-11499 or approved
equal.
   (C)   All lines and fittings shall be capable of withstanding a working
pressure of not less than one hundred twenty five (125) psi and shall be so
rated by the manufacturer. One fitting of the meter swivel shall be insulated.
   (D)   Service connections, where the gas consumption will be in excess of
the capacity of the above specifications, shall be made in the manner specified
by the engineer or Superintendent of Public Utilities. (Ord. 10/67, 2-5-1968;
amd. Ord. 6/72, 12-4-1972, eff. 1-1-1973; Ord. 6/74, 8-1-1974)
8-13-4: METERS:
   (A)   Size And Installation: All gas service shall be metered with a meter
of adequate size to measure the amount of gas consumed. Meters shall be of the
positive type and shall be American Gas Association approved.
   All meters shall be so placed and installed as to render the same accessible
at all times for the purpose of reading and repairing. All meters shall be set
outside of the buildings wherever practical. Indoor installations must be
vented with an adequate vent extending to the outside. (Ord. 10/67, 2-5-1968;
amd. Ord. 6/72, 12-4-1972, eff. 1-1-1973; Ord. 6/74, 8-1-1974)
   (B)   Meter Deposit Application: In those cases where the applicant
requesting service is a tenant, contract purchaser, or a trustee of an Illinois
land trust, the applicant shall also be required to state the capacity in which
he makes application for such service as a condition of approval of the
application, and in those cases, the landlord, contract seller or each
beneficiary of the land trustee, depending upon whatever the case may be, must
also sign the City's meter deposit application form, indicating not only the
capacity in which he signs such form, but also his correct legal mailing
address, including zip code. The City's meter deposit application form shall
state that the owner or occupant of any service is jointly or severally liable
to pay for all utilities furnished to the premises, and in the event any bill
is not paid within thirty (30) days after its rendition, the delinquent bill
shall constitute a lien against the premises. The City Clerk may record a
notice of lien in the Office of the Mercer County Recorder of Deeds in the
event the outstanding balance on any account that is delinquent by more than
thirty (30) days exceeds two hundred dollars ($200.00), and the City Clerk
shall record a notice of lien in the Office of the Mercer County Recorder of
Deeds in the event the outstanding balance on any account that is delinquent by
more than thirty (30) days exceeds three (3) times the monthly average gas bill
for such account over the preceding twelve (12) month period. In addition to
the meter deposit application form, each applicant who is a tenant, contract
purchaser or a trustee of an Illinois land trust for the premises for which the
application is made shall be required to accompany his application with a
deposit pursuant to title 13, "Schedule Of Fees", of this Code to be known as a
meter deposit fee and the deposit proceeds may be used to pay delinquent gas,
water and sewer or service charges or refunded as provided below.
   The meter deposit fee shall be deposited in the Meter Deposit Fund and in
the event any customer discontinues service and has paid in full all amounts
due for gas, water and sewer and service charges, then the full amount of the
deposit shall be refunded. However, in the event that any amounts are due from
said customer, either for gas, water and sewer or service charges, then such
amounts shall be deducted and paid into the proper fund and the balance shall
be refunded.
   Any tenant, contract purchaser or trustee of an Illinois land trust who has
paid a deposit and later becomes the owner of record of the property served
shall, upon application to the City, be refunded his deposit. (Ord. 16/2017, 6-
5-2017)
8-13-5: INSPECTIONS:
At all reasonable hours, meters, regulators, fittings, fixtures and
appurtenances connected with the system and located on private property shall
be open for inspection by the proper officers and employees of the City. Any
part found to be defective or not in compliance with the provisions of this
chapter shall be immediately repaired or corrected. Service may be discontinued
at any time when conditions of the privately owned facilities create danger or
hazard. (Ord. 10/67, 2-5-1968; amd. Ord. 6/72, 12-4-1972, eff. 1-1-1973; Ord.
6/74, 8-1-1974)
8-13-6: METER READING CONCLUSIVE:
All gas customers shall be liable for the gas consumption as shown by the
meter. Waste, leakage or other causes not the liability of the City shall be
included under said liability. The meter reading shall be conclusive provided
that whenever the City shall find any meter not registering, then an average
bill may be rendered based at the option of the City, on either the nearest
previous three (3) months' average use, when meter was in good order, or based
on the same month or months of the preceding year. Whenever the City shall have
reason to believe that the meter is not registering correctly, then an average
bill as stated above may be rendered and the meter removed for testing. If such
average bill should prove to be incorrectly estimated, either by actual
testing, or by actual gas consumption, after being replaced by a corrected
meter, then such bill shall be compared to the same. (Ord. 10/67, 2-5-1968;
amd. Ord. 6/72, 12-4-1972, eff. 1-1-1973; Ord. 6/74, 8-1-1974)
8-13-7: TEST OF METERS:
Any consumer may request the City to make a test of the accuracy of the meter
then in use on their premises. Prior to conducting the test the consumer shall
be required to deposit with the City a fee pursuant to title 13, "Schedule Of
Fees", of this Code for a residential meter testing conducted by the City. In
the event that an independent test is requested or required, the deposit shall
be the amount necessary to cover all expenses associated therewith.
In the event such meter is found by testing to register incorrectly at full
capacity by more than two percent (2%) then another accurate meter shall be
substituted and the test deposit shall be refunded. Past gas bills shall be
adjusted by refund or credit of such percentage of the amount of the gas bills
for a period of not more than two (2) months previous to such test.
In the event that the meter is found to be registering at two percent (2%) or
less error the consumer shall forfeit the test deposit and such funds shall be
deposited in the gas operating funds of the City. (Ord. 16/2017, 6-5-2017)
8-13-8: SEPARATE METERS FOR EACH DISTINCT PREMISES:
No person shall connect any gas service pipe or transmit gas supplied by the
natural gas system of the City into two (2) distinct premises from one meter.
Apartment buildings having separate dwelling units may be serviced from a
single meter. Duplex dwellings shall be serviced from individual meters. (Ord.
10/67, 2-5-1968; amd. Ord. 6/72, 12-4-1972, eff. 1-1-1973; Ord. 6/74, 8-1-1974)
8-13-9: DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT:
Whenever a meter, regulator or other equipment of a service connection which
has been installed by the City is found to have been damaged for any cause
whatsoever, such damages shall become the liability of the customer who shall
pay the City the actual cost of removal, repairing and/or replacing of such
damaged equipment.
In the event such damage has caused inaccurate metering, then such gas bills
shall be corrected in the manner previously provided for herein to cover such
period that the meter was out of order. (Ord. 10/67, 2-5-1968; amd. Ord. 6/72,
12-4-1972, eff. 1-1-1973; Ord. 6/74, 8-1-1974)
8-13-10: PARTIES LIABLE FOR PAYMENT FOR GAS SERVICE; DELINQUENT GAS BILLS TO BE
LIENS UPON THE REAL ESTATE:
The owner of the premises and the occupant thereof shall be jointly and
severally liable to pay for the gas service furnished to said premises and the
gas service is furnished to the premises by the City only upon the condition
that the owner of the premises and the occupant thereof are jointly and
severally liable therefor to the City. The City reserves the right to stop any
gas service when billings for gas service are delinquent and have not been paid
by said owner or occupant within thirty (30) days of the date of rendition.
Furthermore, all gas bills not paid within thirty (30) days from the date of
rendition, which are deemed to be delinquent as provided below, shall
constitute liens upon the real estate for which such services are supplied, and
the Clerk is hereby authorized and directed to file sworn statements showing
such delinquencies in the Office of the Recorder of Deeds of Mercer County,
Illinois, and the filing of such statement(s) shall be deemed notice for the
nonpayment of such charges for such gas service. (Ord. 10/67, 2-5-1968)
8-13-11: GAS RATE SCHEDULE:
All natural gas furnished to any City gas customer shall be subject to a
combination of variable and flat rates. Each gas customer shall pay a meter/
facility fee in the fixed amount of $14.00 per month per meter. Gas rates shall
be based upon a fixed distribution charge of $2.50 per 1,000 cubic feet (or
part thereof) used by each customer, plus 102% of the actual cost incurred by
the city for its purchase of gas, as set forth in title 13, "Schedule Of Fees",
of this Code. Non-residents of the City will be billed a twice the rate of
residents; provided however, that natural gas furnished to a customer for use
on land that is: a) used for farming purposes, b) comprised of ten (10) acres
or more, and c) located outside of the corporate limits of the City shall be
charged the gas rate determined by the City for resident customers. In the
event that such farmland subsequently is subdivided to be comprised of less
than ten (10) acres, the gas rate for non-resident customers shall be
applicable.
The natural gas rate shall be effective with the consumption beginning with
meter readings for January 2020 gas usage, to be billed in February 2020, and
shall continue from month to month until such time that the Corporate
Authorities deem it appropriate to amend the rates by ordinance.
If any statement for natural gas service is not paid by the fifth day of the
month following its date of rendition, the account shall be considered
delinquent and a service charge of three percent (3%) for each month or
fraction of a month shall be assessed on the outstanding amount due at the
close of the fifth day of the month following the month during which the
statement in question was rendered, excluding any service charges previously
assessed thereon.
Any consumer refusing or neglecting to pay his statement for a period of thirty
(30) days subsequent to its rendition shall be deprived of the use of gas and
the City shall stop all gas supply to such consumer until such time that all
past due statements are paid including all penalty charges.
Accounts that remain delinquent for more than sixty (60) days, shall incur an
additional twenty-five dollar ($25.00) administrative service fee one the
sixty-first (61st) day following the rendition of the bill for service. (Ord.
18/2018, 12-4-2018; amd. Ord. 50/2019, 1-6-2020; Ord. 08/2024, 4-1-2024)
8-13-12: SERVICE DISCONTINUED; RENEWAL:
The City reserves the right to discontinue gas service to any premises on
account of nonpayment of any charges, or where the owner or tenant of such
premises has been found guilty of a violation of any of the provisions of this
chapter. Where such service is discontinued and the gas is shut off or stopped,
whether by the City or at the request of the property owner, the gas shall not
again be turned on or supplied to such premises until all such delinquent
charges due the City have been paid and there is no existing default or
violation of any of the provisions of the several sections of this chapter. A
written application shall be filed with the Clerk for the renewal of such
service, which application shall be accompanied by a fee pursuant to title 13,
"Schedule Of Fees", of this Code to pay for the shutting off and turning on of
the gas service. No customer shall be permitted to use the stopcock of the
service connection for shutting off gas while making extensions, additions, or
repairs to the pipe or equipment on the premises. Such shutoff or
discontinuance or interruption of service will be made only by the City or its
properly authorized employees. (Ord. 16/2017, 6-5-2017)
8-13-13: INTERRUPTION IN SERVICE OR SUPPLY; CITY NOT LIABLE:
The City shall have the right to shut off the supply of gas whenever it is
necessary to make repairs, improvements, enforce rules or for any operating
reason. In all cases, where possible, a reasonable notice of the circumstances
will be given to the customers, but in an emergency the gas may be shut off
without notice. Such necessary repairs or work will be made by the City as
rapidly as may be practical. The City shall not be held responsible or liable
because of any shutoff or discontinuance of service for any direct or resultant
damages to any person, company or customer.
In the event of such discontinuance of gas service, the city will make every
attempt to safeguard the customer and service shall not be renewed until the
city authorities have purged the lines and put into service all automatic
controls and pilots. The cost of purging of lines, relighting pilots, and
checking automatic controls will be borne by the city and the customer will not
be liable for any portion thereof. Where the nature of the customer's
operations are such that an interruption of service might create a hazard or
large economic loss, such customer shall provide facilities for standby service
if desired.
Whenever mains, pipes, service connections or other facilities of the gas
system are taken up, shut off or interfered with by reasons of any city street
improvement, the city will endeavor to maintain service so far as is reasonably
possible, but will not be directly or indirectly liable for any interruption,
poor pressure or damage of any kind either to the customers adjacent or to
other customers affected thereby. Direct damage to property due to such
operations shall be either repaired or replaced by the city without cost to the
customer.
The city expressly stipulates with all customers and other persons who may be
affected by the discontinuance of service that it will neither insure nor be
responsible or liable in any manner for any loss or damages direct or indirect
by any reason of any fire, or any other cause and all gas service furnished
shall also be conditional upon acts of God, inevitable accidents, fire,
strikes, riots, or any other causes. (Ord. 4/56, 3-4-1957)
8-13-14: CONNECTION WITH PRIVATE LINES:
Whenever a connection is made with a private line, such service shall be
metered at the point of such connection and the customer requesting such
service shall provide a satisfactory location for the placing of such metering
devices, regulators and other materials and equipment required. Such private
lines shall be subject to the inspection and approval of the city prior to
making the necessary service connections.
The city shall have the right and option to demand charges, removal or
replacement of any pipe, fixtures or apparatus which is considered to be
faulty, inadequate or hazardous; provided, however, that this provision shall
not obligate the city in any way or manner. The city shall have the right to
refuse or to discontinue gas service without notice to its customers if the
city finds any apparatus or appliance in operation which would be detrimental
to the efficient operation of the existing facilities.
All persons are strictly forbidden to attach any electrical ground wire to any
fixture or piping which is or may be connected to any gas service pipe, meter
or main belonging to the city. The city will hold the owner of the premises
responsible and liable for any damage to its property or injury to the
employees of the city caused by such ground wire. Any and all customers shall
remove any existing ground wires immediately and if such ground wires are not
removed after twenty four (24) hours' written notice, the city through its
officials, may enter the property and remove such ground wires and the customer
shall pay all costs. All questions and complaints shall be made to the gas
department of the city who shall be responsible for proper investigation. The
department shall be required to make a full report to the customer in all such
cases, a copy of which shall be filed with the clerk and reported by him to the
council at the next regular meeting. Any disrespectful or unwarranted acts of
the city employees shall be reported immediately. All employees of the city are
strictly forbidden to demand or accept any tips, gratuity, or other personal
compensation for any services whatsoever rendered during working hours. (Ord.
4/56, 3-4-1957)
8-13-15: REGULATIONS; CUSTOMERS:
All house piping shall be of rigid construction. The pipe from the outlet of
the meter shall be of iron pipe of not less than one inch (1") inside diameter
and shall enter the house wall or be securely fastened to the wall by means of
suitable metal strap or clamp at a point not more than eighteen inches (18")
from the outlet connection of the meter, and if extended along the outside wall
shall be fastened to the wall at intervals sufficient to make the piping rigid
throughout. In instances where piping from meter enters the wall, the opposite
end shall be securely fastened so that pipe will not turn when fittings at the
meter are put on. The piping from the meter through or along the wall shall
constitute, and hereinafter be called the "house pipe manifold". The one inch
(1") manifold will be used where the total hourly demand for gas does not
exceed four hundred (400) cubic feet per hour. Where the total hourly demand of
a building or house is in excess of four hundred (400) cubic feet of gas per
hour the city engineering department must be consulted for specifications for
the house pipe manifold.
From any house pipe manifold, pipe to the various appliances shall be of the
same dimensions as the fitting on the appliance where such appliance is
designed and approved for natural gas. Where appliances are to be converted
from liquefied petroleum gas, pipe from the manifold to the appliance shall be
of such size as would be approved by the American Gas Association for natural
gas appliances having the same BTU input rating.
From the house pipe manifold any appliance pipe may be extended a maximum
distance of forty (40) linear feet. For each ninety degree (90°) turn in the
appliance pipe three (3) linear feet shall be deducted from the maximum
distance. Copper pipe may be substituted for iron pipe from the manifold to the
appliance. Copper pipe must have OD dimension equivalent to ID of standard iron
pipe. Only type K copper pipe may be used. All copper fittings must be of flare
type only. When copper tubing is used, insulated copper to iron fittings must
be used at the meter end and appliance end of the tubing.
No connection will be made with any house type manifold that has not been
tested for leakage.
All gas conversion burners to be installed,shall be AGA approved. All designed
heating plants shall be AGA approved and the manufacturer's recommendations for
the installation shall be followed.
No conversion burner shall be installed in an old or inefficient warm air
furnace which is in poor repair or in an old or leaky boiler which is in poor
repair. Test for leakage shall be with oil of wintergreen or smoke bomb on any
warm air heating plant before installing a conversion burner. Furnaces must be
reset if found to be leaking.
Before connecting a flue or vent connector into any chimney, the chimney shall
be examined to ascertain that it is properly constructed, clear, clean and will
freely conduct the products of combustion from the gas heating appliance in
question to the outer air.
All appliances, excepting cook stoves, with over eight thousand (8,000) BTU per
hour input rating must be vented. No unvented appliance excepting cook stoves,
shall be placed in the same room with a gas refrigerator. An approved type vent
pipe and draft diverter shall be installed on all gas burning space heating and
water heating appliances; vent pipe shall be installed with not less than one-
half inch (1/2") rise per foot of horizontal run. General rules for venting as
prescribed by AGA must be followed.
All positive type catches on the firing door shall be eliminated and a hinge
pin and spring be installed.
All heating plants of the down draft type shall be vented by connecting a one
inch (1") black iron pipe from the highest point of the flue passage of the
heating plant to the flue pipe. The one inch (1") iron pipe shall be welded or
screwed into the furnace in a manner to assure no leakage.
A gas shutoff shall be installed in the fuel line directly above the appliance
manifold connection. Said shutoff to be plainly marked. Gas pilot line shall be
connected to fuel line ahead of main shutoff valve.
A high limit control shall be installed on all heating plants. A low water
cutoff control shall be installed on all gas fired steam boilers.
All gas burning appliances shall be installed in a location in which the
facilities for ventilation permit satisfactory combustion of gas and proper
venting under normal conditions of use. The necessary measures shall be taken
to ascertain that the above ventilation conditions are present.
The final tie in of the gas line to the meter shall be made by the city. Before
the final tie is made it shall be the duty of the city gas department to make a
complete inspection. (Ord. 4/56, 3-4-1957)
8-13-16: RULES; CONTRACT:
All the rules and regulations concerning the natural gas system of the city and
the consumption of gas therefrom shall become a part of the contract with every
gas customer, and every gas customer shall be subject thereto and bound
thereby. (Ord. 4/56, 3-4-1957)
8-13-17: EXTENSIONS:
The city shall not be required to extend mains and service within the city
limits, a distance of more than one hundred feet (100') per customer and only
then when sufficient funds are available in excess of those required for the
proper operation of the system. Extension of mains and service outside of the
city limits shall be subject to approval of the council and shall be also
subject to all of the rules and regulations and provisions as provided herein
or as may be amended. (Ord. 4/56, 3-4-1957; amd. Ord. 9/74, 12-2-1974)
Where service is desired when funds for extensions are not available or/and
when the distance is in excess of the one hundred feet (100') per customer
noted above, such extension can be made if the applicant will deposit with the
city the estimated cost of making the extension, less one hundred feet (100')
when funds are available, or the entire amount when funds are not available.
The amounts so deposited shall be refunded to such consumer or consumers at the
rate of fifty percent (50%) of each monthly billing until the total deposited
has been refunded. Such deposit shall be interest free. In the event that the
amount deposited is greater or less than the actual cost of the extension, such
excess or deficiency shall be corrected prior to giving service.
Deposits made under the provisions of this section shall not exempt the
applicant from the payment of all other charges required by this chapter.
Amounts received by the city for such extensions shall be deposited in the
meter deposit fund and payments for refunds shall likewise be paid from the
same fund. (Ord. 4/56, 3-4-1957)
8-13-18: TAMPERING WITH SYSTEM:
It shall be unlawful for any person to break the seal of any meter or in any
manner to make any alterations, changes or repairs on the same or to open any
mains, laterals, service pipe, stopcocks, valves, or any part thereof or
otherwise tamper with or attempt to do any work on either or any of them
without authority of the city or its properly authorized agent. Any person who
shall violate any of the provisions of this section or who shall wilfully or
maliciously injure or damage any property connected with the gas system of the
city shall be subject to the penalty hereinafter prescribed. (Ord. 4/56, 3-4-
1957)
8-3-19: GAS COMMITTEE:
The mayor shall appoint a committee of four (4) members of the council as a gas
committee, one of whom shall be appointed as chairman. It shall be the gas
committee's duty to confer with the duly authorized agent appointed to operate
and maintain the gas system of the city and to institute such additional rules
and regulations for the operation of the gas department as may be required for
its efficient operation from time to time. All action of the committee shall be
subject to the approval of the council. (Ord. 4/56, 3-4-1957; amd. Ord. 9/74,
12-2-1974)
8-13-20: BUDGET BILLING OF NATURAL GAS:
Notwithstanding the billing procedures for natural gas based on actual usage
set forth in section
8-13-11 of this chapter, customers of the natural gas utility operated by the
city of Aledo shall have the right to elect budget billing of natural gas,
which will equalize each monthly bill for said gas usage as nearly as is
possible under the circumstances, provided that said budget billing shall be
offered by the city to all its customers upon the terms and conditions as
hereinafter set forth:
   (A)   Each customer electing the benefits of budget billing shall execute a
written contract incorporating all the terms and conditions for budget billing
as set forth in the ordinance codified herein. In the event there is more than
one owner or occupant of the premises on which budget billing is elected, then
all owners or all tenants of the premises in question must execute the written
contract required in this section before the benefits of budget billing shall
be made available to anyone requesting said billing method for natural gas.
   (B)   Each customer electing budget billing shall indicate to the city clerk
whether a fiscal budget year beginning May 1 or June 1 is desired, which
election once made is binding upon the customer for that respective fiscal
budget year. The city clerk shall have the right to assume that the customer
desires the same fiscal budget year for all subsequent periods during which
budget billing is in effect unless the customer notifies the city clerk in
writing thirty five (35) days before the last day of the then current fiscal
budget year in question that a new fiscal budget year as defined herein is
desired by the customer.
   (C)   Subject to the right of the city to adjust the monthly budget bill as
provided in subsection (G) of this section, the city clerk and the director of
public works and utilities shall cooperate in computing the monthly budget bill
for the customer and shall use the following formula in computing the monthly
budget bill: 1) the actual use of natural gas by the premises in question for
the most recent eleven (11) consecutive billing periods prior to the first day
of the fiscal budget year in question for said customer shall be totaled and
then divided by eleven (11); 2) the then current gas rate for natural gas for
said type of customer as of the first day of the fiscal budget year in question
for said customer shall be multiplied by one hundred ten percent (110%); and 3)
the quotient computed in part 1) of this subsection shall be multiplied by the
product computed in part 2) of this subsection, which product shall be equal to
the monthly budget bill.
   Subject to the provisions of subsection (G) of this section, the customer
will be billed in eleven (11) equal monthly installments, said billing period
to begin on May 1 or June 1 of the fiscal budget year in question, with the
first budget bill to be rendered during June or July of the fiscal budget year
in question, said month depending upon the fiscal budget year last elected by
the customer. In the month of April or May, following, depending upon whatever
the case may be, the customer will be billed for actual gas used in that
billing period plus any amount necessary to bring total payments in balance
with the total use for the twelve (12) month period ending on the last day of
the last regular billing period for the fiscal budget year in question for said
customer. If the customer's total payments exceed the total gas usage, a refund
will be made by the city within a reasonable time, but not to exceed forty five
(45) days after the last day of the particular fiscal budget year last elected
by the customer.
   (D)   Each monthly budget statement will show the consumption of natural gas
for the billing period, the cost thereof, the budget balance existing on the
last day of the billing period, and the amount of the normal monthly budget
payment due.
   (E)   All budget statements not paid by the fifth day of the month following
the month of rendition of such statement are subject to an additional ten
percent (10%) charge on the amount of the monthly budget bill to cover the cost
of administration and if not paid within thirty (30) days from the date of
rendition, the account shall be considered delinquent on said date with the
following consequences:
      1.   The privilege of budget billing for said customer shall be
immediately revoked;
      2.   The customer shall not have the right to elect again budget billing
for the fiscal year in question;
      3.   The city shall have the right to terminate its gas service to the
customer as soon as the customer's credit balance, if any, for purchases of
natural gas has been depleted; and
      4.   If the customer owes the city for natural gas purchased, the city
may institute suit against the customer for the delinquent amount owed,
including penalty charges, plus an assessment of reasonable attorney fees
incurred by the city in instituting said suit and postjudgment proceedings, if
necessary.
   (F)   Anyone desiring to elect the benefit of budget billing must meet the
following requirements:
   The premises using the city's natural gas service must have been hooked up
to the city's natural gas system for at least eleven (11) consecutive months
prior to the beginning of the fiscal budget year selected by the customer for
budget billing.
   In addition, budget billing shall be available only to a customer who
executes an agreement and begins making the agreed monthly budget payments in
June or July as provided in said agreement, except a customer who executes an
agreement after the beginning of his selected fiscal budget year may still
elect the benefits of budget billing upon condition that the customer pays, if
necessary, in one lump sum, a sufficient amount so that the customer shall have
paid to the city the sum of all monthly budget bills due beginning with the
first month of the fiscal year selected through the end of the month during
which the agreement was executed. Failure by the customer to make said lump sum
payment, if required, on or before the fifth day of the month following the
month of rendition of a statement for said amount, shall result in the customer
being subject to those provisions set forth in subsection (E) of this section.
   (G)   There are many factors that affect the cost and usage of natural gas
supplied to any particular premises, including, but not limited to, an increase
in the cost of natural gas purchased by the city from its supplier,
installation of additional appliances or equipment in the premises that use
natural gas, and/or abnormal changes in normal expected weather conditions. Due
to said factors, the city hereby reserves the right to revise the monthly
budget bill from time to time to adjust for such factors when said change in
rates or usage variations from the estimated quantities are substantial. The
director of public works and utilities and the city clerk may adopt reasonable
rules and regulations required for determining the standards when said monthly
budget bills may be revised pursuant to the provisions of this section.
Furthermore, the city clerk and the director of public works and utilities
shall have the right to consult with and rely upon the opinion of outside
engineers or other qualified experts recognized in the field of natural gas
usage and cost thereof in determining when and to what extent monthly budget
bills need to be adjusted.
   (H)   Any agreement, once signed, shall automatically renew itself for an
additional identical budget fiscal year last elected by the customer unless
either party to the written agreement notifies the other in writing thirty five
(35) days before the last day of the fiscal budget year in question that said
party desires to terminate the agreement providing for budget billing.
   (I)   The written agreement shall be binding on all successors and assigns
of each party to said agreement, subject to the limited exception set forth in
subsection (J) of this section.
   (J)   If a customer electing budget billing sells the premises in question,
or if the customer is a tenant under a lease, then budget billing for natural
gas shall cease as of the date the customer relinquishes possession of the
premises. The customer shall have the responsibility of notifying the city not
less than five (5) days prior to the date that possession will be relinquished.
Failure to notify shall result in the city having the right to base its
settlement as hereinafter defined as of a normal working day not more than
seven (7) days after notice is finally given to the city by the customer.
Settlement under this subsection shall be made on the basis of the customer
being billed for the actual gas used during the regular billing period in
question when possession will be relinquished from the first day of said
regular billing period through the date possession is relinquished (or a date
not more than 7 days after notice is finally given the City by the customer of
a sale or the termination of a lease in the event the customer fails to give
notice thereof to the City 5 days before the date that possession will be
relinquished). In addition, the customer shall be billed an amount necessary to
bring the total payments in balance with the total actual use for the regular
billing periods from the first day of the fiscal budget year in question
through the last day of the regular billing period prior to the billing period
in which notice is finally given by the customer to the City that a sale or
lease terminating either will or has occurred and either a relinquishment of
possession will occur on a given date or has occurred as of a certain date. If
the customer's total payments exceed the total gas usage for the entire period
defined in the previous two (2) sentences, a refund will be made by the City
within a reasonable time, but not to exceed forty five (45) days after the date
that the customer finally gives notice to the City under the provisions of this
subsection.
   Termination under this subsection shall not release the customer of any
liabilities created by reason of the written agreement. Furthermore, in case of
the death or incompetency of the customer, the customer's duly authorized
personal representative shall have the obligation of carrying out the terms and
provisions of not only this subsection, but the entire ordinance, including,
but not limited to, any notice requirements provided for herein.
   (K)   The Mayor and the City Clerk are hereby authorized on behalf of the
City to sign each agreement, incorporating the terms and conditions of the
ordinance codified herein, under which budget billing shall be made available
to any customer requesting said billing method for natural gas service. (Ord.
7/77, 7-18-1977)
8-13-21: PAYMENT OF CHARGES:
   (A)   Notwithstanding the payment provisions of sections
8-13-11 and
8-13-20 of this chapter, any customer of the City natural gas system during
calendar years 1979-1980 who is eligible for assistance in payment of natural
gas used as primary heating source of his or her individual residence,
depending upon whatever the case may be, shall be deemed to be a member of a
special class of customer of the natural gas system owner and operated by the
City and accordingly, said customer shall be subject to those rules of payment
for the use of natural gas during those periods of time as hereinafter set
forth.
   (B)   In lieu of only direct payments for use of natural gas by customers
eligible for assistance under the 1979-1980 federally funded Energy Crisis
Assistance Program, the City hereby agrees to accept payment from the agency
administering assistance payments under the 1979-1980 Energy Crisis Assistance
Program to be applied first against any existing indebtedness owed by such
customers for the use of natural gas as of December 1, 1979, if any, and then
said assistance payments shall be then applied against any charges for natural
gas used and consumed by such customers for that period of time beginning on
December 1, 1979, and ending on September 30, 1980, unless said period is ended
sooner due to termination of the election to receive benefits under the Energy
Crisis Assistance Program by the City or the agency in question terminates
benefits under said program by proper notice to the City or the customer
discontinues the natural gas service provided by the City. (Ord. 29/79, 1-7-
1980)
   (C)   Any assistance payments received from the agency administering the
Energy Crisis Assistance Program shall not be used to pay for any reconnection
charge levied against any such customer eligible for benefits under said Act,
said reconnection fees being authorized and permitted pursuant to title 13,
"Schedule Of Fees", of this Code, nor shall such assistance payments under the
aforesaid Act be used to pay for any security deposit, if any, that may be
imposed by the City and required to be paid by any customer who has either
elected or will be electing to connect to the natural gas service owned and
operated by the City. (Ord. 16/2017, 6-5-2017)
   (D)   The City hereby agrees to credit all assistance payments received by
it as directed by the agency administering all of the benefits to be paid under
the 1979-1980 Energy Crisis Assistance Program, including, but not limited to,
the requirement that only one maximum allowable payment under said Act be
applied to the account of each such eligible person.
   (E)   The City hereby agrees to release any and all information that may be
required by the administering agency of the 1979-1980 Energy Crisis Assistance
Program in order to determine any particular customer's eligibility for
benefits under said Act, provided that said customer agrees and authorizes the
release of said information.
   (F)   The City may terminate its election to receive benefits under the
Energy Crisis Assistance Program upon giving a thirty (30) day written notice
thereof to the agency administering benefits under said Act.
   (G)   In the event an eligible customer owes any further balance due for
natural gas used as of the date of his or her application after applying the
maximum benefit due under the Energy Crisis Assistance Program, the City shall
then offer to the customer for that amount due and owing a deferred payment
arrangement or a level payment plan that is deemed reasonable and acceptable by
both the City and the customer, said plan to include payment of any
reconnection fee or security deposit.
   (H)   Any other provision in conflict herewith shall not be deemed to apply
to those customers of the natural gas system owned and operated by the City who
are eligible for assistance under the 1979-1980 Energy Crisis Assistance
Program.
   (I)   The Mayor, City Clerk, and/or the Director of Public Works and
Utilities are hereby authorized to execute and deliver with the City Seal
impressed thereon any and all documents that may be required in order for the
City to elect to receive all those benefits that it may be entitled to receive
under the provisions of the 1979-1980 Federal Energy Assistance Program. (Ord.
29/79, 1-7-1980)
8-13-22: DELINQUENT BILLS; PAYMENT IN INSTALLMENTS:
   (A)   Notwithstanding the provisions of section
8-13-11 of this chapter, any gas customer of the City who has a delinquent gas
bill under the provisions of the foregoing section shall have the right to
enter into a written contract with the City providing for the payment of the
delinquent bill in three (3) equal installments thirty (30) days apart.
Moreover, the right of the customer to elect to enter into a written contract
with the City to pay any delinquent gas bill in three (3) equal installments
thirty (30) days apart shall include the obligation of the customer to pay all
current gas bills rendered by the City to the customer during the term of the
written contract in a timely manner as specified in section
8-13-11 of this chapter. If the customer shall fail to pay any equal
installment payment on or before the due date as herein provided or shall fail
to pay any current gas bill on or before due date as required pursuant to
section
8-13-11 of this chapter during the term of the written contract for the payment
of the delinquent bill, then the City shall have the right to terminate the gas
service to the customer instanter without any further notice to the customer.
   (B)   The right of any customer to pay any delinquent gas bill to the City
in the manner specified in subsection (A) of this section shall be limited to
two (2) times during any twelve (12) month period. (Ord. 3/82, 6-21-1982)
   (C)   If any customer of the City gas system executes an appropriate
delinquent gas bill payment contract, then the City shall not terminate such
natural gas service to said customer during the term of the delinquent gas bill
payment contract provided that the customer complies with all terms and
conditions of the aforesaid contract. However, if natural gas service has been
terminated to the customer at the time he executes an appropriate delinquent
gas bill payment contract, then the customer shall have the right to have the
natural gas service renewed and the fee for renewal as provided in title 13,
"Schedule Of Fees", of this Code, shall be added to the delinquent gas bill and
paid off in three (3) equal installments thirty (30) days apart notwithstanding
the provisions of section
8-13-12 of this chapter, which requires that the renewal fee be paid in full
before restoration of gas service. (Ord. 16/2017, 6-5-2017)
   (D)   The written contract providing for the payment of a delinquent gas
bill in three (3) equal installments thirty (30) days apart shall require that
the first equal installment be paid in full at the time the written contract is
signed by the customer. The second equal installment shall then be paid in full
on or before thirty (30) days after the date of the written contract, and the
final equal installment shall then be paid on or before sixty (60) days after
the date of the written contract.
   (E)   In addition to the right of the customer to elect only twice within a
twelve (12) month period the right to pay any delinquent gas bill in three (3)
equal installments thirty (30) days apart, no customer shall have the right to
elect such option during the term of a written contract which is in default by
reason of the customer having failed to comply with the terms and provisions
thereof. Moreover, such customer shall be required to pay in full any such
delinquency for which he has signed a written contract before he can sign
another written contract to pay off any delinquent gas bill.
   (F)   The City Clerk is hereby authorized to execute and deliver on behalf
of the City the requisite written contract providing for the payment of
delinquent gas bill(s) in three (3) equal installments thirty (30) days apart
which shall be signed by the customer electing such option.
   (G)   Notwithstanding any of the foregoing provisions, in any case where the
gas customer of the City is a tenant or lessee of a landowner(s), then such
right of the customer to elect to pay a delinquent gas bill in three (3) equal
installments by signing an appropriate delinquent gas bill payment contract
shall require the consent of the landowner(s).
   If the landowner(s) of any tenant or lessee desiring to elect to pay any
delinquent gas bill in three (3) equal installments refuses to sign the
delinquent gas bill payment contract, then such tenant or lessee shall not be
eligible to elect the benefits of deferred payment as herein provided. (Ord. 3/
82, 6-21-1982)
8-13-23: DELINQUENT CUSTOMERS; NEW CONNECTIONS:
No City gas customer who has a delinquent gas account shall be permitted to
secure either a new and/or additional gas service connection(s) to the City
natural gas service until all delinquent accounts of any such gas customer have
been paid in full. This prohibition shall also extend to any City gas customer
who may have elected to pay a delinquent account in three (3) equal monthly
installments as provided under section
8-13-22 of this chapter. It shall be no defense to this prohibition against new
or additional connections to the City natural gas system while an applicant has
a delinquent gas account with the City that such applicant has a contract in
good standing under the terms of section
8-13-22 of this chapter.
The term "City gas customer" whenever used herein shall include any person,
partnership, corporation or any other entity that has applied for and is
connected to the City natural gas system. It shall also include any of the
foregoing whether acting as owner, lessor, lessee or in any other capacity if
such person, partnership, corporation or other type of entity may be liable for
the payment of such delinquent gas accounts albeit that the foregoing class
description may not have been the actual applicant or the user of the gas
service that created the delinquency. (Ord. 29/82, 2-7-1983)
CHAPTER 14
ENCROACHMENTS
SECTION:
8-14-1:   Definitions
8-14-2:   Encroachment Unlawful
8-14-3:   Project Right Of Way Lines
8-14-4:   Permissible Encroachment
8-14-1: DEFINITIONS:
   CONSTRUCTION EASEMENT AREA: That area lying between the project right of way
limits and the platted street limits within which the city, by concurrence in
the establishment of the project right of way lines, will permit the state to
enter to perform all necessary construction operations.
   ENCROACHMENT: Any building, fence, sign, or any other structure or object of
any kind (with the exception of utilities and public road signs), which is
placed, located or maintained in, on, under, or over any portion of the right
of way or the roadway right of way where no project right of way line has been
established.
   PERMISSIBLE ENCROACHMENT: Any existing awning, marquee, advertising sign or
similar overhanging structure supported from a building immediately adjacent to
the limits of the platted street where there is a sidewalk extending to the
building line and which does not impair the free and safe flow of traffic on
the highway; the permissive retention of overhanging signs is not to be
constructed outside the project right of way line and not confined by adjacent
buildings.
   PROJECT RIGHT OF WAY: Those areas within the project right of way lines
established jointly by the city, state and the United States bureau of public
roads which will be free of encroachments except as hereinafter defined.
   ROADWAY RIGHT OF WAY: Those areas existing or acquired by dedication or by
fee simple for highway purposes; also, the areas acquired by temporary easement
during the time the easement is in effect. (Ord. 2/70, 6-1-1970)
8-14-2: ENCROACHMENT UNLAWFUL:
It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to erect or cause to
be erected, to retain or cause to be retained, any "encroachment" (hereinabove
defined), except as provided in section
8-14-3 of this chapter, within the limits of the project right of way or
roadway right of way where no project right of way lines have been established.
(Ord. 2/70, 6-1-1970)
8-14-3: PROJECT RIGHT OF WAY LINES:
Project right of way lines have been established at the following locations:
   (A)   Along the south side of SW 3rd Street, thirty six feet (36') from the
centerline of the proposed improvement between 10th and 11th Avenues.
   (B)   Along the north side of SW 3rd Street, twenty six feet (26') north of
the centerline of the proposed improvement between College and SW Second
Avenues. (Ord. 2/70, 6-1-1970)
8-14-4: PERMISSIBLE ENCROACHMENT:
Revocable permits have been issued by the city for temporary retention of the
following permissible encroachment:
   TEEM LAUNDROMAT sign on front of building on the south side of SW 3rd Street
between SW 6th and SW 7th Avenues. (Ord. 2/70, 6-1-1970)
CHAPTER 15
CABLE COMMUNICATIONS FRANCHISE CODE
SECTION:
8-15-1:   Title
8-15-2:   Purpose
8-15-3:   Definitions
8-15-4:   Franchise Required
8-15-5:   Grant Of Nonexclusive Authority
8-15-6:   Rules Of Grantee
8-15-7:   Franchise Territory
8-15-8:   Construction Standards
8-15-9:   Undergrounding Or Aerial Constructing Of Cable
8-15-10:   Technical Standards
8-15-11:   Lockout System
8-15-12:   Subscriber Customer Services
8-15-13:   Public Benefit Obligation
8-15-14:   Franchise Fees
8-15-15:   Insurance And Indemnification
8-15-16:   Unauthorized Connections And Modifications
8-15-17:   State Franchise Holder
8-15-18:   Penalties
8-15-1: TITLE:
This chapter shall be known and cited as the CITY OF ALEDO CABLE COMMUNICATIONS
FRANCHISE CODE. (Ord. 23/2017, 6-19-2017)
8-15-2: PURPOSE:
The City of Aledo finds that the development of cable television and
communications systems greatly benefit and impact the residents, commercial
activities, and businesses of the City. The City intends, by the adoption of
